alert.note: Alert for La Junta Vicinity, Otero County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 2:54PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River At La Junta affecting La Junta Vicinity/Otero County zone. For the Lower Arkansas River...including La Junta...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Arkansas River At La Junta. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood. Flood waters threaten Highway 194 east of La Junta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM MDT.
